4934  p_out_pkt->p_buffer;
4935  p_out_pkt->av1_p_data[p_out_pkt->av1_buffer_index] =
4936  p_out_pkt->p_data;
4937  p_out_pkt->av1_buffer_size[p_out_pkt->av1_buffer_index] =
4938  p_out_pkt->buffer_size;
4939  p_out_pkt->av1_data_len[p_out_pkt->av1_buffer_index] =
4940  p_out_pkt->data_len;
4941  p_out_pkt->av1_buffer_index++;
4942  p_out_pkt->p_buffer = NULL;
4943  p_out_pkt->p_data = NULL;
4944  p_out_pkt->buffer_size = 0;
4945  if (p_out_pkt->av1_buffer_index >= MAX_AV1_ENCODER_GOP_NUM)
4946  {
4947  ni_log(
4948  NI_LOG_ERROR,
4949  "Error: recv AV1 not shown frame number %d >= %d\n",
4950  p_out_pkt->av1_buffer_index,
4951  MAX_AV1_ENCODER_GOP_NUM);
4952  return -1;
4953  }
4954  } else
4955  {
4956  write_av1_ivf_header(p_enc_ctx, p_out_pkt, 0, 0, 0, p_file);
4957  muxed_number_of_packets++;
4958  if (p_out_pkt->av1_buffer_index)
4959  {
4960  ni_packet_buffer_free_av1(p_out_pkt);
4961  }
4962  }
4963  }
4964  } else
4965  {
4966  if (p_file &&
4967  (fwrite((uint8_t *)p_out_pkt->p_data + meta_size,
4968  p_out_pkt->data_len - meta_size, 1, p_file) != 1))
4969  {
4970  fprintf(stderr, "Error: writing data %u bytes error!\n",
4971  p_out_pkt->data_len - meta_size);
4972  fprintf(stderr, "Error: ferror rc = %d\n", ferror(p_file));
4973  }
4974  }
4975 
4976  *total_bytes_received += rx_size - meta_size;
4977 
4978  if (0 == p_enc_ctx->pkt_num)
4979  {
4980  p_enc_ctx->pkt_num = 1;
4981  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "got encoded stream header, keep reading ..\n");
4982  goto receive_data;
4983  }
4984  (*nb_pkts_received)++;
4985 
4986  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Got: Packets= %u\n", *nb_pkts_received);
4987  } else if (rx_size != 0)
4988  {
4989  fprintf(stderr, "Error: received %d bytes, <= metadata size %d!\n",
4990  rx_size, meta_size);
4991  return NI_TEST_RETCODE_FAILURE;
4992  } else if (!end_flag &&
4993  ((ni_xcoder_params_t *)(p_enc_ctx->p_session_config))
4994  ->low_delay_mode)
4995  {
4996  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "low delay mode and NO pkt, keep reading ..\n");
4997  goto receive_data;
4998  } else
4999  {
5000  if (end_flag)
5001  {
5002  if (SESSION_RUN_STATE_SEQ_CHANGE_DRAINING ==
5003  p_enc_ctx->session_run_state)
5004  {
5005  // after sequence change completes, reset codec state
5006  ni_log(NI_LOG_INFO, "encoder_receive_data: sequence "
5007  "change completed, return SEQ_CHANGE_DONE and will reopen "
5008  "or reconfig codec!\n");
5009 
5010  rc = encoder_reinit_session(p_enc_ctx, p_in_data, p_out_data);
5011  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "encoder_receive_data: encoder_reinit_session ret %d\n", rc);
5012  if (rc == NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
5013  {
5014  return NI_TEST_RETCODE_SEQ_CHANGE_DONE;
5015  }
5016  else
5017  {
5018  return NI_TEST_RETCODE_FAILURE;
5019  }
5020  }
5021 
5022  if (p_enc_ctx->codec_format == NI_CODEC_FORMAT_AV1 &&
5023  p_out_pkt->av1_buffer_index)
5024  {
5025  // output previous packets
5026  if (p_file)
5027  {
5028  write_av1_ivf_header(p_enc_ctx, p_out_pkt, 0, 0, 0, p_file);
5029  muxed_number_of_packets++;
5030  if (muxed_number_of_packets) // update frame_count in ivf start header
5031  {
5032  fseek(p_file, 24, SEEK_SET);
5033  uint8_t frame_cnt[4] = {
5034  (muxed_number_of_packets & 0xff),
5035  ((muxed_number_of_packets >> 8) & 0xff),
5036  ((muxed_number_of_packets >> 16) & 0xff),
5037  ((muxed_number_of_packets >> 24) & 0xff)};
5038  if (fwrite(frame_cnt, 4, 1, p_file) != 1)
5039  {
5040  fprintf(stderr,
5041  "Error: failed to update frame_cnt in ivf "
5042  "header!\n");
5043  fprintf(stderr, "Error: ferror rc = %d\n",
5044  ferror(p_file));
5045  return -1;
5046  }
5047  }
5048  }
5049  ni_packet_buffer_free_av1(p_out_pkt);
5050  }
5051  }
5052  }
5053 
5054  if (print_time)
5055  {
5056  int timeDiff = (int)(current_time.tv_sec - start_time.tv_sec);
5057  if (timeDiff == 0)
5058  {
5059  timeDiff = 1;
5060  }
5061  printf("[R] Got:%d Packets= %u fps=%f Total bytes %llu\n", rx_size,
5062  *nb_pkts_received,
5063  ((float)(*nb_pkts_received)) / ((float)timeDiff),
5064  *total_bytes_received);
5065  }
5066 
5067  if (end_flag)
5068  {
5069  printf("Encoder Receiving done.\n");
5070  return NI_TEST_RETCODE_END_OF_STREAM;
5071  } else if (0 == rx_size)
5072  {
5073  return NI_TEST_RETCODE_EAGAIN;
5074  }
5075  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "encoder_receive_data: success\n");
5076 
5077  return NI_TEST_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
5078 }
5079 
5080 /*!*****************************************************************************
5081  * \brief Set up hard coded demo ROI map
5082  *
5083  * \param
5084  *
5085  * \return none
5086  ******************************************************************************/
5087 void set_demo_roi_map(ni_session_context_t *p_enc_ctx)
5088 {
5089  ni_xcoder_params_t *p_param =
5090  (ni_xcoder_params_t *)(p_enc_ctx->p_session_config);
5091  uint32_t i, j, sumQp = 0;
5092  uint32_t mbWidth, mbHeight, numMbs;
5093  // mode 1: Set QP for center 1/3 of picture to highest - lowest quality
5094  // the rest to lowest - highest quality;
5095  // mode non-1: reverse of mode 1
5096  int importanceLevelCentre = p_param->roi_demo_mode == 1 ? 40 : 10;
5097  int importanceLevelRest = p_param->roi_demo_mode == 1 ? 10 : 40;
5098  int32_t width, height;
5099 
5100  if (!p_enc_ctx->roi_map)
5101  {
5102  p_enc_ctx->roi_map =
5103  (ni_enc_quad_roi_custom_map *)calloc(1, p_enc_ctx->roi_len);
5104  }
5105  if (!p_enc_ctx->roi_map)
5106  {
5107  return;
5108  }
5109  uint32_t roiMapBlockUnitSize = 64; // HEVC
5110  uint32_t max_cu_size = 64; // HEVC
5111  if (NI_CODEC_FORMAT_H264 == p_enc_ctx->codec_format)
5112  {
5113  max_cu_size = 16;
5114  roiMapBlockUnitSize = 16;
5115  }
5116 
5117  width = p_param->source_width;
5118  height = p_param->source_height;
5119  // AV1 non-8x8-aligned resolution is implicitly cropped due to Quadra HW limitation
5120  if (NI_CODEC_FORMAT_AV1 == p_enc_ctx->codec_format)
5121  {
5122  width = (width / 8) * 8;
5123  height = (height / 8) * 8;
5124  }
5125 
5126  mbWidth =
5127  ((width + max_cu_size - 1) & (~(max_cu_size - 1))) /
5128  roiMapBlockUnitSize;
5129  mbHeight =
5130  ((height + max_cu_size - 1) & (~(max_cu_size - 1))) /
5131  roiMapBlockUnitSize;
5132  numMbs = mbWidth * mbHeight;
5133 
5134  // copy roi MBs QPs into custom map
5135  bool bIsCenter;
5136  // number of qp info (8x8) per mb or ctb
5137  uint32_t entryPerMb = (roiMapBlockUnitSize / 8) * (roiMapBlockUnitSize / 8);
5138 
5139  for (i = 0; i < numMbs; i++)
5140  {
5141  if ((i % mbWidth > mbWidth / 3) && (i % mbWidth < mbWidth * 2 / 3))
5142  bIsCenter = 1;
5143  else
5144  bIsCenter = 0;
5145 
5146  for (j = 0; j < entryPerMb; j++)
5147  {
5148  /*
5149  g_quad_roi_map[i*4+j].field.skip_flag = 0; // don't force
5150  skip mode g_quad_roi_map[i*4+j].field.roiAbsQp_flag = 1; //
5151  absolute QP g_quad_roi_map[i*4+j].field.qp_info = bIsCenter
5152  ? importanceLevelCentre : importanceLevelRest;
5153  */
5154  p_enc_ctx->roi_map[i * entryPerMb + j].field.ipcm_flag =
5155  0; // don't force skip mode
5156  p_enc_ctx->roi_map[i * entryPerMb + j].field.roiAbsQp_flag =
5157  1; // absolute QP
5158  p_enc_ctx->roi_map[i * entryPerMb + j].field.qp_info =
5159  bIsCenter ? importanceLevelCentre : importanceLevelRest;
5160  }
5161  sumQp += p_enc_ctx->roi_map[i * entryPerMb].field.qp_info;
5162  }
5163  p_enc_ctx->roi_avg_qp =
5164  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(clang-analyzer-core.DivideZero)
5165  (sumQp + (numMbs >> 1)) / numMbs; // round off
5166 }
5167 
5168 /*!*****************************************************************************
5169  * \brief Encoder session open
5170  *
5171  * \param
5172  *
5173  * \return 0 if successful, < 0 otherwise
5174  ******************************************************************************/
5175 int encoder_open_session(
5176  ni_session_context_t *p_enc_ctx, int dst_codec_format, int iXcoderGUID,
5177  ni_xcoder_params_t *p_enc_params, int src_bit_depth, int width, int height,
5178  ni_hrd_params_t *hrd_params, ni_color_primaries_t color_primaries,
5179  ni_color_transfer_characteristic_t color_trc, ni_color_space_t color_space,
5180  int video_full_range_flag, int sar_num, int sar_den, int is_planar)
5181 {
5182  int ret = 0;
5183 
5184  p_enc_ctx->p_session_config = p_enc_params;
5185  p_enc_ctx->session_id = NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID;
5186  p_enc_ctx->codec_format = dst_codec_format;
5187 
5188  // assign the card GUID in the encoder context and let session open
5189  // take care of the rest
5190  p_enc_ctx->device_handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
5191  p_enc_ctx->blk_io_handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
5192  p_enc_ctx->hw_id = iXcoderGUID;
5193 
5194  // default: little endian
5195  p_enc_ctx->src_bit_depth = src_bit_depth;
5196  p_enc_ctx->src_endian = NI_FRAME_LITTLE_ENDIAN;
5197  p_enc_ctx->bit_depth_factor = 1;
5198  p_enc_ctx->pixel_format =
5199  (is_planar ? NI_PIX_FMT_YUV420P : NI_PIX_FMT_NV12);
5200  if (10 == p_enc_ctx->src_bit_depth)
5201  {
5202  p_enc_ctx->bit_depth_factor = 2;
5203  p_enc_ctx->pixel_format =
5204  (is_planar ? NI_PIX_FMT_YUV420P10LE : NI_PIX_FMT_P010LE);
5205  }
5206 
5207  // original resolution this stream started with, this is used by encoder sequence change
5208  p_enc_ctx->ori_width = width;
5209  p_enc_ctx->ori_height = height;
5210  p_enc_ctx->ori_bit_depth_factor = p_enc_ctx->bit_depth_factor;
5211  p_enc_ctx->ori_pix_fmt = p_enc_ctx->pixel_format;
5212 
5213  int linesize_aligned = width;
5214  if (linesize_aligned < NI_MIN_WIDTH)
5215  {
5216  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.conf_win_right +=
5217  (NI_MIN_WIDTH - width) / 2 * 2;
5218  linesize_aligned = NI_MIN_WIDTH;
5219  } else
5220  {
5221  linesize_aligned = ((width + 1) / 2) * 2;
5222  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.conf_win_right +=
5223  (linesize_aligned - width) / 2 * 2;
5224  }
5225  p_enc_params->source_width = linesize_aligned;
5226 
5227  int height_aligned = height;
5228  if (height_aligned < NI_MIN_HEIGHT)
5229  {
5230  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.conf_win_bottom +=
5231  (NI_MIN_HEIGHT - height) / 2 * 2;
5232  height_aligned = NI_MIN_HEIGHT;
5233  } else
5234  {
5235  height_aligned = ((height + 1) / 2) * 2;
5236  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.conf_win_bottom +=
5237  (height_aligned - height) / 2 * 2;
5238  }
5239  p_enc_params->source_height = height_aligned;
5240 
5241  // VUI setting including color setting is done by specifying them in the
5242  // encoder config
5243  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.colorDescPresent = 0;
5244  // ToDo: when to enable
5245  if ((color_primaries != NI_COL_PRI_UNSPECIFIED) ||
5246  (color_space != NI_COL_SPC_UNSPECIFIED) ||
5247  (color_trc != NI_COL_TRC_UNSPECIFIED))
5248  {
5249  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.colorDescPresent = 1;
5250  }
5251  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.colorPrimaries = color_primaries;
5252  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.colorTrc = color_trc;
5253  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.colorSpace = color_space;
5254  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.videoFullRange = video_full_range_flag;
5255  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.aspectRatioWidth = sar_num;
5256  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.aspectRatioHeight = sar_den;
5257 
5258  p_enc_ctx->framerate.framerate_denom = p_enc_params->fps_denominator;
5259  p_enc_ctx->framerate.framerate_num = p_enc_params->fps_number;
5260 
5261  // default planar encoder input data; ToDo: HW frames
5262  p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.planar = is_planar;
5263 
5264  p_enc_params->video_full_range_flag = video_full_range_flag;
5265 
5266  ret = ni_device_session_open(p_enc_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER);
5267  if (ret < 0)
5268  {
5269  fprintf(stderr, "Error: encoder_open_session failure!\n");
5270  } else
5271  {
5272  printf("Encoder device %d session open successful.\n", iXcoderGUID);
5273  }
5274 
5275  // set up ROI QP map for ROI demo modes if enabled
5276  if (p_enc_params->cfg_enc_params.roi_enable &&
5277  (1 == p_enc_params->roi_demo_mode || 2 == p_enc_params->roi_demo_mode))
5278  {
5279  set_demo_roi_map(p_enc_ctx);
5280  }
5281 
5282  return ret;
5283 }
5284 
5285 /*!*****************************************************************************
5286  * \brief encoder session close
5287  *
5288  * \param
5289  *
5290  * \return 0 if successful, < 0 otherwise
5291  ******************************************************************************/
5292 int encoder_close_session(ni_session_context_t *p_enc_ctx,
5293  ni_session_data_io_t *p_in_data,
5294  ni_session_data_io_t *p_out_data)
5295 {
5296  int ret = 0;
5297  ni_device_session_close(p_enc_ctx, 1, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER);
5298 
5299  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "encoder_close_session - close encoder blk_io_handle %d device_handle %d\n", p_enc_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_enc_ctx->device_handle);
5300 #ifdef _WIN32
5301  ni_device_close(p_enc_ctx->device_handle);
5302 #elif __linux__
5303  ni_device_close(p_enc_ctx->device_handle);
5304  ni_device_close(p_enc_ctx->blk_io_handle);
5305 #endif
5306 
5307  if (p_enc_ctx->codec_format == NI_CODEC_FORMAT_AV1 &&
5308  p_out_data->data.packet.av1_buffer_index)
5309  {
5310  ni_packet_buffer_free_av1(&(p_out_data->data.packet));
5311  }
5312  ni_frame_buffer_free(&(p_in_data->data.frame));
5313  ni_packet_buffer_free(&(p_out_data->data.packet));
5314  return ret;
5315 }
5316 
5317 /*!*****************************************************************************
5318  * \brief encoder session init
5319  *
5320  * \param
5321  *
5322  * \return 0 if successful, < 0 otherwise
5323  ******************************************************************************/
5324 int encoder_init_session(ni_session_context_t *p_enc_ctx,
5325  ni_session_data_io_t *p_in_data,
5326  ni_session_data_io_t *p_out_data,
5327  int arg_width,
5328  int arg_height,
5329  int bit_depth)
5330 {
5331  int ret = 0;
5332  ni_xcoder_params_t *p_api_param = (ni_xcoder_params_t *)p_enc_ctx->p_session_config;
5333 
5334  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "XCoder encode sequence change (re-open): session_run_state %d\n", p_enc_ctx->session_run_state);
5335 
5336  // for encode from YUV, use all the parameters specified by user
5337  ret = encoder_open_session(
5338  p_enc_ctx, p_enc_ctx->codec_format, p_enc_ctx->hw_id, p_api_param, bit_depth,
5339  arg_width, arg_height, NULL, p_api_param->color_primaries,
5340  p_api_param->color_transfer_characteristic, p_api_param->color_space,
5341  p_api_param->video_full_range_flag, p_api_param->sar_num, p_api_param->sar_denom,
5342  get_pixel_planar(p_in_data->data.frame.pixel_format) == NI_PIXEL_PLANAR_FORMAT_PLANAR);
5343  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != ret)
5344  {
5345  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to Re-open Encoder Session upon Sequence Change (status = %d)\n", ret);
5346  return ret;
5347  }
5348 
5349  p_out_data->data.packet.end_of_stream = 0;
5350  p_in_data->data.frame.start_of_stream = 1;
5351  return ret;
5352 }
5353 
5354 int encoder_sequence_change(ni_session_context_t *p_enc_ctx,
5355  ni_session_data_io_t *p_in_data,
5356  ni_session_data_io_t *p_out_data,
5357  int width,
5358  int height,
5359  int bit_depth_factor)
5360 {
5361  ni_retcode_t ret = 0;
5362 
5363  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "XCoder encode sequence change (reconfig): session_run_state %d\n", p_enc_ctx->session_run_state);
5364 
5365  ret = ni_device_session_sequence_change(p_enc_ctx, width, height, bit_depth_factor, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER);
5366 
5367  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != ret)
5368  {
5369  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to send Sequence Change to Encoder Session (status = %d)\n", ret);
5370  return ret;
5371  }
5372 
5373  // update session context
5374  p_enc_ctx->bit_depth_factor = bit_depth_factor;
5375  p_enc_ctx->src_bit_depth = (bit_depth_factor == 1) ? 8 : 10;
5376  // xcoder demo only support little endian (for 10-bit pixel format)
5377  p_enc_ctx->src_endian = NI_FRAME_LITTLE_ENDIAN;
5378  p_enc_ctx->ready_to_close = 0;
5379  p_enc_ctx->frame_num = 0; // need to reset frame_num because pkt_num is set to 1 when header received after sequnce change, and low delay mode compares frame_num and pkt_num
5380  p_enc_ctx->pkt_num = 0; // also need to reset pkt_num because before header received, pkt_num > frame_num will also cause low delay mode stuck
5381  p_enc_ctx->pixel_format = p_in_data->data.frame.pixel_format;
5382  p_out_data->data.packet.end_of_stream = 0;
5383  p_in_data->data.frame.start_of_stream = 1;
5384  return ret;
5385 }
5386 
5387 /*!*****************************************************************************
5388  * \brief decoder session open
5389  *
5390  * \param
5391  *
5392  * \return 0 if successful, < 0 otherwise
5393  ******************************************************************************/
5394 int decoder_open_session(ni_session_context_t *p_dec_ctx, int iXcoderGUID,
5395  ni_xcoder_params_t *p_dec_params)
5396 {
5397  int ret = 0;
5398 
5399  p_dec_ctx->p_session_config = p_dec_params;
5400  p_dec_ctx->session_id = NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID;
5401 
5402  // assign the card GUID in the encoder context and let session open
5403  // take care of the rest
5404  p_dec_ctx->device_handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
5405  p_dec_ctx->blk_io_handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
5406  p_dec_ctx->hw_id = iXcoderGUID;
5407 
5408  if (p_dec_params->dec_input_params.hwframes)
5409  {
5410  p_dec_ctx->hw_action = NI_CODEC_HW_ENABLE;
5411  } else
5412  {
5413  p_dec_ctx->hw_action = NI_CODEC_HW_NONE;
5414  }
5415 
5416  ret = ni_device_session_open(p_dec_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER);
5417 
5418  if (ret < 0)
5419  {
5420  fprintf(stderr, "Error: ni_decoder_session_open() failure!\n");
5421  return -1;
5422  } else
5423  {
5424  printf("Decoder device %d session open successful.\n", iXcoderGUID);
5425  return 0;
5426  }
5427 }
5428 
5429 /*!*****************************************************************************
5430  * \brief Encoder session open
5431  *
5432  * \param
5433  *
5434  * \return 0 if successful, < 0 otherwise
5435  ******************************************************************************/
5436 int uploader_open_session(ni_session_context_t *p_upl_ctx, int iXcoderGUID,
5437  int src_bit_depth, int width, int height,
5438  int is_planar, int pool_size)
5439 {
5440  int ret = 0;
5441  p_upl_ctx->session_id = NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID;
5442 
5443  // assign the card GUID in the encoder context and let session open
5444  // take care of the rest
5445  p_upl_ctx->device_handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
5446  p_upl_ctx->blk_io_handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
5447  p_upl_ctx->hw_id = iXcoderGUID;
5448 
5449  // default: little endian
5450  p_upl_ctx->src_bit_depth = src_bit_depth;
5451  p_upl_ctx->src_endian = NI_FRAME_LITTLE_ENDIAN;
5452  p_upl_ctx->bit_depth_factor = 1;
5453  p_upl_ctx->pixel_format =
5454  (is_planar ? NI_PIX_FMT_YUV420P : NI_PIX_FMT_NV12);
5455  if (10 == p_upl_ctx->src_bit_depth)
5456  {
5457  p_upl_ctx->bit_depth_factor = 2;
5458  p_upl_ctx->src_bit_depth = 10;
5459  p_upl_ctx->pixel_format =
5460  (is_planar ? NI_PIX_FMT_YUV420P10LE : NI_PIX_FMT_P010LE);
5461  } else if (32 == p_upl_ctx->src_bit_depth)
5462  {
5463  //rgba, not currently supported in this tool
5464  fprintf(stderr, "Error: uploader rgba is toDO!\n");
5465  return -1;
5466  }
5467  p_upl_ctx->active_video_width = width;
5468  p_upl_ctx->active_video_height = height;
5469 
5470  ret = ni_device_session_open(p_upl_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_UPLOAD);
5471  if (ret < 0)
5472  {
5473  fprintf(stderr, "Error: uploader_open_session failure!\n");
5474  return ret;
5475  } else
5476  {
5477  printf("Uploader device %d session open successful.\n", iXcoderGUID);
5478  }
5479  ret = ni_device_session_init_framepool(p_upl_ctx, pool_size, 0);
5480  if (ret < 0)
5481  {
5482  fprintf(stderr, "Error: uploader_config_session failure!\n");
5483  } else
5484  {
5485  printf("Uploader device %d configured successful.\n", iXcoderGUID);
5486  }
5487  return ret;
5488 }
5489 
5490 void print_usage(void)
5491 {
5492  printf("Video decoder/encoder/transcoder application directly using Netint "
5493  "Libxcoder release v%s\n"
5494  "Usage: xcoder [options]\n"
5495  "\n"
5496  "options:\n"
5497  "-h | --help Show help.\n"
5498  "-v | --version Print version info.\n"
5499  "-t | --multi-thread Enable multi-threaded sending and receiving"
5500  " in all modes.\n"
5501  "-l | --loglevel Set loglevel of libxcoder API.\n"
5502  " [none, fatal, error, info, debug, trace]\n"
5503  " (Default: info)\n"
5504  "-c | --card Set card index to use.\n"
5505  " See `ni_rsrc_mon` for cards on system.\n"
5506  " (Default: 0)\n"
5507  "-i | --input Input file path.\n"
5508  "-r | --repeat (Positive integer) to Repeat input X \n"
5509  " times for performance test.(Default: 1)\n"
5510  "-p | --is_planar Indicate whether the input yuv is planar.\n"
5511  " (Default: 1)\n"
5512  "-s | --size Resolution of input file in format "
5513  "WIDTHxHEIGHT.\n"
5514  " (eg. '1920x1080')\n"
5515  "-m | --mode Input to output codec processing mode in "
5516  "format:\n"
5517  " InType2OutType. [a2y, h2y, y2a, u2a, y2h, "
5518  "u2h, a2a, "
5519  "a2h, h2a, h2h, y2x, y2o, u2x, v2y, v2a, v2h, v2x, h2x, a2x]\n"
5520  " Type notation: y=YUV420P a=AVC, h=HEVC, "
5521  "v=VP9, x=AV1 IVF, o=AV1 OBU, "
5522  "u=hwupload yuv\n"
5523  "-b | --bitdepth Input and output bit depth. [8, 10]\n"
5524  " (Default: 8)\n"
5525  "-x | --xcoder-params Encoding params. See \"Encoding "
5526  "Parameters\" chapter in\n"
5527  " "
5528  "QuadraIntegration&ProgrammingGuide*.pdf for help.\n"
5529  " "
5530  "Can be specified multiple (max MAX_OUTPUT_FILES) times \n"
5531  " "
5532  "for HWUpload + Encoding for non-AV1 codec in single \n"
5533  " "
5534  "thread mode. Must match the number of -o specified.\n"
5535  " (Default: \"\")\n"
5536  "-d | --decoder-params Decoding params. See \"Decoding "
5537  "Parameters\" chapter in\n"
5538  " "
5539  "QuadraIntegration&ProgrammingGuide*.pdf for help.\n"
5540  " (Default: \"\")\n"
5541  "-o | --output Output file path.\n"
5542  " "
5543  "Can be specified multiple (max MAX_OUTPUT_FILES) times \n"
5544  " "
5545  "for HWUpload + Encoding for non-AV1 codec in single \n"
5546  " "
5547  "thread mode. Must match the number of -x specified.\n"
5548  "-f | --vf Scaling params. Example: "
5549  "ni_width=1280:ni_height=720:format=0:p2p=1.\n",
5550  NI_XCODER_REVISION);
5551 }
5552 
5553 void *decoder_send_thread(void *args)
5554 {
5555  dec_send_param_t *p_dec_send_param = args;
5556  ni_session_context_t *p_dec_ctx = p_dec_send_param->p_dec_ctx;
5557  int sos_flag = 1;
5558  int retval;
5559 
5560  printf("decoder_send_thread start: async_mode %d decoder_low_delay %d\n",
5561  p_dec_ctx->async_mode, p_dec_ctx->decoder_low_delay);
5562  for (;;)
5563  {
5564  retval = decoder_send_data(
5565  p_dec_ctx, p_dec_send_param->p_in_pkt, sos_flag,
5566  p_dec_send_param->input_video_width,
5567  p_dec_send_param->input_video_height, p_dec_send_param->pkt_size,
5568  total_file_size, p_dec_send_param->p_total_bytes_sent,
5569  p_dec_send_param->print_time, p_dec_send_param->p_xcodeState,
5570  p_dec_send_param->p_stream_info);
5571  sos_flag = 0;
5572  if (retval < 0) // Error
5573  {
5574  fprintf(stderr, "Error: decoder_send_thread break!\n");
5575  break;
5576  } else if (p_dec_send_param->p_xcodeState->dec_eos_sent) //eos
5577  {
5578  printf("decoder_send_thread reach eos\n");
5579  break;
5580  }
5581  }
5582 
5583  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "decoder_send_thread exit\n");
5584  return NULL;
5585 }
5586 
5587 void *decoder_receive_thread(void *args)
5588 {
5589  dec_recv_param_t *p_dec_recv_param = args;
5590  ni_test_frame_list_t *frame_list = p_dec_recv_param->test_frame_list;
5591  ni_session_data_io_t *p_out_frame = NULL;
5592  ni_frame_t *p_ni_frame = NULL;
5593  int retval;
5594  int print_time;
5595  struct timeval previous_time_l = previous_time;
5596  int rx_size = 0;
5597  printf("decoder_receive_thread start\n");
5598  for (;;)
5599  {
5600  if (p_dec_recv_param->mode == XCODER_APP_DECODE)
5601  {
5602  (void)ni_gettimeofday(&current_time, NULL);
5603  print_time = ((current_time.tv_sec - previous_time.tv_sec) > 1);
5604  p_ni_frame = &p_dec_recv_param->p_out_frame->data.frame;
5605  retval = decoder_receive_data(
5606  p_dec_recv_param->p_dec_ctx, p_dec_recv_param->p_out_frame,
5607  p_dec_recv_param->output_video_width,
5608  p_dec_recv_param->output_video_height, p_dec_recv_param->p_file,
5609  p_dec_recv_param->p_total_bytes_received, print_time,
5610  1, // save to file
5611  p_dec_recv_param->p_xcodeState,
5612  &rx_size);
5613 
5614  if (p_dec_recv_param->p_dec_ctx->hw_action == NI_CODEC_HW_ENABLE)
5615  {
5616  niFrameSurface1_t *p_hwframe = (niFrameSurface1_t *)p_dec_recv_param->p_out_frame->data.frame.p_data[3];
5617  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "decoder_receive_thread HW decode-only. recycle HW frame idx %u\n", p_hwframe->ui16FrameIdx);
5618  ni_hwframe_buffer_recycle(p_hwframe, (ni_device_handle_t)(int64_t)p_hwframe->device_handle);
5619  ni_frame_buffer_free(p_ni_frame);
5620  } else
5621  {
5622  ni_decoder_frame_buffer_free(p_ni_frame);
5623  }
5624 
5625  if (retval < 0) // Error
5626  {
5627  fprintf(
5628  stderr,
5629  "Error: decoder_receive_thread break in decode mode!\n");
5630  break;
5631  } else if (p_ni_frame->end_of_stream) //eos
5632  {
5633  printf("decoder_receive_thread reach eos\n");
5634  break;
5635  } else if (retval == 2)
5636  {
5637  ni_usleep(100);
5638  }
5639  if (print_time)
5640  {
5641  previous_time = current_time;
5642  }
5643  } else
5644  {
5645  while (test_frames_isfull(frame_list))
5646  {
5647  ni_usleep(100);
5648  }
5649  print_time = ((current_time.tv_sec - previous_time_l.tv_sec) > 1);
5650  p_out_frame = &frame_list->ni_test_frame[frame_list->tail];
5651  p_ni_frame = &p_out_frame->data.frame;
5652  retval = decoder_receive_data(
5653  p_dec_recv_param->p_dec_ctx, p_out_frame,
5654  p_dec_recv_param->output_video_width,
5655  p_dec_recv_param->output_video_height, p_dec_recv_param->p_file,
5656  p_dec_recv_param->p_total_bytes_received, print_time,
5657  0, // do not save to file
5658  p_dec_recv_param->p_xcodeState,
5659  &rx_size);
5660  if (retval < 0) // Error
5661  {
5662  if (!p_dec_recv_param->p_dec_ctx->hw_action)
5663  {
5664  ni_decoder_frame_buffer_free(p_ni_frame);
5665  } else
5666  {
5667  ni_frame_buffer_free(p_ni_frame);
5668  }
5669  fprintf(
5670  stderr,
5671  "Error: decoder_receive_thread break in transcode mode!\n");
5672  break;
5673  } else if (p_ni_frame->end_of_stream) //eos
5674  {
5675  enq_test_frames(frame_list);
5676  printf("decoder_receive_thread reach eos\n");
5677  break;
5678  } else if (retval == 2) // eagain
5679  {
5680  if (!p_dec_recv_param->p_dec_ctx->hw_action)
5681  {
5682  ni_decoder_frame_buffer_free(p_ni_frame);
5683  } else
5684  {
5685  ni_frame_buffer_free(p_ni_frame);
5686  }
5687  ni_usleep(100);
5688  } else
5689  {
5690  if (p_dec_recv_param->p_dec_ctx->hw_action)
5691  {
5692  uint16_t current_hwframe_index =
5693  ((niFrameSurface1_t *)((uint8_t *)
5694  p_ni_frame->p_data[3]))
5695  ->ui16FrameIdx;
5696  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "decoder recv:%d, tail:%d\n",
5697  current_hwframe_index, frame_list->tail);
5698  }
5699  enq_test_frames(frame_list);
5700  }
5701  if (print_time)
5702  {
5703  // current_time will be updated in transcode mode
5704  previous_time_l = current_time;
5705  }
5706  }
5707  }
5708 
5709  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "decoder_receive_thread exit\n");
5710  return NULL;
5711 }
5712 
5713 void *encoder_send_thread(void *args)
5714 {
5715  enc_send_param_t *p_enc_send_param = args;
5716  ni_session_context_t *p_enc_ctx = p_enc_send_param->p_enc_ctx;
5717  ni_test_frame_list_t *frame_list = p_enc_send_param->test_frame_list;
5718  ni_session_data_io_t *p_dec_frame = NULL;
5719  ni_session_data_io_t *p_upl_frame = NULL;
5720  ni_frame_t *p_ni_frame = NULL;
5721  int need_to_resend = 0;
5722  int input_exhausted = 0;
5723  int sos_flag = 1;
5724  int retval;
5725  int input_index = 0;
5726  int input_total = p_enc_send_param->input_total;
5727  int is_last_input;
5728  void *tmp_buf;
5729  if (ni_memalign(&tmp_buf, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), MAX_YUV_FRAME_SIZE))
5730  {
5731  fprintf(stderr,
5732  "Error: Could not allocate YUV data buffer. encoder_send_thread will termiate.");
5733  return NULL;
5734  }
5735 
5736  printf("encoder_send_thread start\n");
5737  for (;;)
5738  {
5739  if (p_enc_send_param->mode == XCODER_APP_ENCODE)
5740  {
5741  is_last_input = (input_index == (input_total-1)) ? 1 : 0;
5742 
5743  retval = encoder_send_data(
5744  p_enc_ctx, tmp_buf,
5745  p_enc_send_param->p_in_frame,
5746  sos_flag,
5747  p_enc_send_param->input_arg_width[input_index],
5748  p_enc_send_param->input_arg_height[input_index],
5749  p_enc_send_param->input_arg_pfs[input_index],
5750  total_file_size,
5751  p_enc_send_param->p_total_bytes_sent,
5752  p_enc_send_param->p_xcodeState,
5753  p_enc_send_param->input_bit_depth[input_index],
5754  is_last_input);
5755  sos_flag = 0;
5756  if (retval < 0) // Error
5757  {
5758  fprintf(stderr,
5759  "Error: encoder_send_thread break in encode mode!\n");
5760  break;
5761  } else if (retval == NI_TEST_RETCODE_NEXT_INPUT) // next input (will trigger sequence change)
5762  {
5763  input_index++;
5764  lseek(p_enc_send_param->input_arg_pfs[input_index], 0, SEEK_END);
5765  total_file_size = lseek(p_enc_send_param->input_arg_pfs[input_index], 0, SEEK_CUR);
5766  lseek(p_enc_send_param->input_arg_pfs[input_index], 0, SEEK_SET);
5767  data_left_size = total_file_size;
5768  } else if (p_enc_send_param->p_xcodeState->enc_seq_change) // sequene change
5769  {
5770  ni_usleep(100);
5771  } else if (p_enc_send_param->p_xcodeState->enc_eos_sent) //eos
5772  {
5773  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
5774  "encoder_send_thread reach eos in encode mode!\n");
5775  break;
5776  }
5777  } else if (p_enc_send_param->mode == XCODER_APP_TRANSCODE)
5778  {
5779  while (test_frames_isempty(frame_list))
5780  {
5781  ni_usleep(100);
5782  }
5783  p_dec_frame = &frame_list->ni_test_frame[frame_list->head];
5784  p_ni_frame = &p_dec_frame->data.frame;
5785  retval = encoder_send_data2(
5786  p_enc_ctx, p_enc_send_param->dec_codec_format, p_dec_frame,
5787  p_enc_send_param->p_in_frame, sos_flag,
5788  p_enc_send_param->input_video_width,
5789  p_enc_send_param->input_video_height, p_enc_send_param->pfs,
5790  total_file_size, p_enc_send_param->p_total_bytes_sent,
5791  p_enc_send_param->p_xcodeState);
5792  sos_flag = 0;
5793  if (retval == 0)
5794  {
5795  if (p_enc_send_param->p_enc_ctx->hw_action)
5796  {
5797  // skip copy the frame when eos received.
5798  if (!p_enc_send_param->p_xcodeState->enc_eos_sent)
5799  {
5800  //track in array with unique index, free when enc read finds
5801  //this must be implemented in application space for complete
5802  //tracking of hwframes
5803  //If encoder write had no buffer avail space the next time we
5804  //update the tracker will be redundant
5805  uint16_t current_hwframe_index =
5806  ((niFrameSurface1_t *)((uint8_t *)
5807  p_ni_frame->p_data[3]))
5808  ->ui16FrameIdx;
5809  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
5810  "send frame index:%d, head:%d, eos:%d\n",
5811  current_hwframe_index, frame_list->head,
5812  p_enc_send_param->p_xcodeState->enc_eos_sent);
5813  memcpy(p_enc_send_param->p_hwframe_pool_tracker +
5814  current_hwframe_index,
5815  (uint8_t *)p_ni_frame->p_data[3],
5816  sizeof(niFrameSurface1_t));
5817  }
5818  ni_frame_wipe_aux_data(p_ni_frame); //reusebuff
5819  } else
5820  {
5821  ni_decoder_frame_buffer_free(p_ni_frame);
5822  }
5823  deq_test_frames(frame_list);
5824  } else if (retval < 0) //Error
5825  {
5826  if (p_enc_send_param->p_enc_ctx->hw_action)
5827  {
5828  //pre close cleanup will clear it out
5829  uint16_t current_hwframe_index =
5830  ((niFrameSurface1_t *)((uint8_t *)
5831  p_ni_frame->p_data[3]))
5832  ->ui16FrameIdx;
5833  memcpy(p_enc_send_param->p_hwframe_pool_tracker +
5834  current_hwframe_index,
5835  (uint8_t *)p_ni_frame->p_data[3],
5836  sizeof(niFrameSurface1_t));
5837  } else
5838  {
5839  ni_decoder_frame_buffer_free(p_ni_frame);
5840  }
5841  fprintf(
5842  stderr,
5843  "Error: encoder_send_thread break in transcode mode!\n");
5844  break;
5845  }
5846  if (p_enc_send_param->p_xcodeState->enc_eos_sent) // eos
5847  {
5848  printf("encoder_send_thread reach eos in transcode mode!\n");
5849  break;
5850  }
5851  } else
5852  {
5853  while (test_frames_isempty(frame_list))
5854  {
5855  ni_usleep(100);
5856  }
5857  p_upl_frame = &frame_list->ni_test_frame[frame_list->head];
5858  if (*p_enc_send_param->p_input_exhausted &&
5859  p_upl_frame->data.frame.end_of_stream)
5860  {
5861  input_exhausted = 1;
5862  }
5863  retval = encoder_send_data3(p_enc_send_param->p_enc_ctx,
5864  p_upl_frame, sos_flag,
5865  p_enc_send_param->input_video_width,
5866  p_enc_send_param->input_video_height,
5867  p_enc_send_param->p_xcodeState,
5868  input_exhausted, &need_to_resend);
5869 
5870  sos_flag = 0;
5871  if (retval == 2) //Error
5872  {
5873  fprintf(
5874  stderr,
5875  "Error: encoder_send_thread break in transcode mode!\n");
5876  break;
5877  }
5878 
5879  if (need_to_resend == 0)
5880  {
5881  //successful read means there is recycle to check
5882  uint16_t current_hwframe_index =
5883  ((niFrameSurface1_t *)((uint8_t *)p_upl_frame->data.frame
5884  .p_data[3]))
5885  ->ui16FrameIdx;
5886  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "send frame index:%d, head:%d\n",
5887  current_hwframe_index, frame_list->head);
5888  memcpy((p_enc_send_param->p_hwframe_pool_tracker +
5889  current_hwframe_index),
5890  (uint8_t *)p_upl_frame->data.frame.p_data[3],
5891  sizeof(niFrameSurface1_t));
5892  deq_test_frames(frame_list);
5893  }
5894 
5895  if (p_enc_send_param->p_xcodeState->enc_eos_sent) // eos
5896  {
5897  printf("encoder_send_thread reach eos in upload mode!\n");
5898  break;
5899  }
5900  }
5901  }
5902  ni_aligned_free(tmp_buf);
5903  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "encoder_send_thread exit\n");
5904  return NULL;
5905 }
5906 
5907 void *encoder_receive_thread(void *args)
5908 {
5909  enc_recv_param_t *p_enc_recv_param = args;
5910  ni_packet_t *p_ni_packet = &p_enc_recv_param->p_out_packet->data.packet;
5911  niFrameSurface1_t *p_hwframe = NULL;
5912  int retval;
5913  int print_time;
5914  printf("encoder_receive_thread start\n");
5915  for (;;)
5916  {
5917  (void)ni_gettimeofday(&current_time, NULL);
5918  print_time = ((current_time.tv_sec - previous_time.tv_sec) > 1);
5919  retval = encoder_receive_data(
5920  p_enc_recv_param->p_enc_ctx, p_enc_recv_param->p_out_packet,
5921  p_enc_recv_param->output_video_width,
5922  p_enc_recv_param->output_video_height, p_enc_recv_param->p_file,
5923  p_enc_recv_param->p_total_bytes_received, print_time,
5924  &number_of_packets, p_enc_recv_param->p_buffered_frame);
5925  if (retval < 0) // Error
5926  {
5927  fprintf(stderr, "Error: encoder_receive_thread break!\n");
5928  break;
5929  } else if (p_ni_packet->end_of_stream) // eos
5930  {
5931  printf("encoder_receive_thread reach eos\n");
5932  break;
5933  } else if (retval == NI_TEST_RETCODE_EAGAIN)
5934  {
5935  ni_usleep(100);
5936  } else if (retval == NI_TEST_RETCODE_SEQ_CHANGE_DONE)
5937  {
5938  p_enc_recv_param->p_xcodeState->enc_seq_change = 0;
5939  } else if (p_enc_recv_param->p_enc_ctx->hw_action)
5940  {
5941  //encoder only returns valid recycle index
5942  //when there's something to recycle.
5943  //This range is suitable for all memory bins
5944  if (p_ni_packet->recycle_index > 0 &&
5945  p_ni_packet->recycle_index < NI_GET_MAX_HWDESC_FRAME_INDEX(
5946  p_enc_recv_param->p_enc_ctx->ddr_config))
5947  {
5948  p_hwframe = p_enc_recv_param->p_hwframe_pool_tracker +
5949  p_ni_packet->recycle_index;
5950 
5951  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "recycle index:%d, %d\n",
5952  p_hwframe->ui16FrameIdx,
5953  p_hwframe->device_handle);
5954  if (p_hwframe->ui16FrameIdx)
5955  {
5956  ni_hwframe_buffer_recycle(p_hwframe,
5957  p_hwframe->device_handle);
5958  p_hwframe->ui16FrameIdx = 0;
5959  }
5960  }
5961  }
5962  if (print_time)
5963  {
5964  previous_time = current_time;
5965  }
5966  }
5967 
5968  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "encoder_receive_thread exit\n");
5969  return NULL;
5970 }
5971 
5972 void *uploader_thread(void *args)
5973 {
5974  uploader_param_t *p_upl_param = args;
5975  ni_test_frame_list_t *frame_list = p_upl_param->test_frame_list;
5976  ni_session_data_io_t *p_out_frame = NULL;
5977  int retval;
5978 
5979  printf("uploader_thread start\n");
5980  for (;;)
5981  {
5982  while (test_frames_isfull(frame_list))
5983  {
5984  ni_usleep(100);
5985  }
5986  p_out_frame = &frame_list->ni_test_frame[frame_list->tail];
5987  retval = upload_send_data_get_desc(
5988  p_upl_param->p_upl_ctx, p_upl_param->p_swin_frame, p_out_frame,
5989  p_upl_param->input_video_width, p_upl_param->input_video_height,
5990  p_upl_param->pfs, total_file_size, p_upl_param->p_total_bytes_sent,
5991  p_upl_param->p_input_exhausted);
5992 
5993  if (retval < 0)
5994  {
5995  if (p_upl_param->p_upl_ctx->status ==
5996  NI_RETCODE_NVME_SC_WRITE_BUFFER_FULL)
5997  { //No space to write to, wait for downstream to free some
5998  ni_usleep(100);
5999  continue;
6000  }
6001  fprintf(stderr, "Error: uploader_thread break!\n");
6002  break;
6003  } else if (*p_upl_param->p_input_exhausted) // eos
6004  {
6005  enq_test_frames(frame_list);
6006  printf("uploader_thread reach eos\n");
6007  break;
6008  }
6009  uint16_t current_hwframe_index =
6010  ((niFrameSurface1_t *)((uint8_t *)
6011  p_out_frame->data.frame.p_data[3]))
6012  ->ui16FrameIdx;
6013  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "uploader:%d, tail:%d\n", current_hwframe_index,
6014  frame_list->tail);
6015  enq_test_frames(frame_list);
6016  }
6017 
6018  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "uploader_thread exit\n");
6019  return NULL;
6020 }
6021 
6022 static int ni_scaler_params_set_value(ni_filter_params_t *params,
6023  const char *name, const char *value)
6024 {
6025  if (!params)
6026  {
6027  printf("Error: Null pointer parameters passed\n");
6028  return -1;
6029  }
6030 
6031  if (!name)
6032  {
6033  printf("Error: Null name pointer parameters passed\n");
6034  return -1;
6035  }
6036 
6037  if (!strcmp("scale_width", name))
6038  {
6039  params->scale_width = atoi(value);
6040  } else if (!strcmp("scale_height", name))
6041  {
6042  params->scale_height = atoi(value);
6043  } else if (!strcmp("p2p", name))
6044  {
6045  int is_p2p = atoi(value);
6046  params->p2p = is_p2p;
6047  } else if (!strcmp("format", name))
6048  {
6049  int format = atoi(value);
6050  if (format == 0)
6051  {
6052  params->format = GC620_I420;
6053  } else if (format == 1)
6054  {
6055  params->format = GC620_RGBA8888;
6056  } else if (format == 2)
6057  {
6058  params->format = GC620_RGB888_PLANAR;
6059  } else
6060  {
6061  printf("Error: invallid scaler parameters\n");
6062  return -1;
6063  }
6064  } else
6065  {
6066  printf("Error: invallid scaler parameters\n");
6067  return -1;
6068  }
6069  return 0;
6070 }
6071 
6072 static int retrieve_filter_params(char xcoderParams[],
6073  ni_filter_params_t *params)
6074 {
6075  char key[64], value[64];
6076  char *curr = xcoderParams, *colon_pos;
6077  int ret = 0;
6078 
6079  while (*curr)
6080  {
6081  colon_pos = strchr(curr, ':');
6082 
6083  if (colon_pos)
6084  {
6085  *colon_pos = '\0';
6086  }
6087 
6088  if (strlen(curr) > sizeof(key) + sizeof(value) - 1 ||
6089  ni_param_get_key_value(curr, key, value))
6090  {
6091  fprintf(stderr,
6092  "Error: scaler-params key/value not "
6093  "retrieved: %s\n",
6094  curr);
6095  ret = -1;
6096  break;
6097  }
6098  ret = ni_scaler_params_set_value(params, key, value);
6099  if (ret != 0)
6100  {
6101  printf("Error: failed to parse the input scaler parameters\n");
6102  ret = -1;
6103  break;
6104  }
6105 
6106  if (colon_pos)
6107  {
6108  curr = colon_pos + 1;
6109  } else
6110  {
6111  curr += strlen(curr);
6112  }
6113  }
6114  return ret;
6115 }
6116 
6117 /*!*****************************************************************************
6118  * \brief Init scaler params here - both user setting params and fixed params.
6119  *
6120  * \param
6121  *
6122  * \return 0 if successful, < 0 otherwise
6123  ******************************************************************************/
6124 void init_scaler_params(ni_scaler_input_params_t *p_scaler_params,
6125  ni_scaler_opcode_t op, int in_rec_width,
6126  int in_rec_height, int in_rec_x, int in_rec_y,
6127  int out_rec_x, int out_rec_y)
6128 {
6129  p_scaler_params->op = op;
6130  // input_format/width/height, output_format/width/height should be assigned by users for all ops
6131  if (op == NI_SCALER_OPCODE_CROP)
6132  {
6133  // fixed numbers
6134  p_scaler_params->out_rec_width = 0;
6135  p_scaler_params->out_rec_height = 0;
6136  p_scaler_params->out_rec_x = 0;
6137  p_scaler_params->out_rec_y = 0;
6138  p_scaler_params->rgba_color = 0;
6139 
6140  // params set by user
6141  p_scaler_params->in_rec_width = in_rec_width;
6142  p_scaler_params->in_rec_height = in_rec_height;
6143  p_scaler_params->in_rec_x = in_rec_x;
6144  p_scaler_params->in_rec_y = in_rec_y;
6145  } else if (op == NI_SCALER_OPCODE_SCALE)
6146  {
6147  // fixed params
6148  p_scaler_params->in_rec_width = 0;
6149  p_scaler_params->in_rec_height = 0;
6150  p_scaler_params->in_rec_x = 0;
6151  p_scaler_params->in_rec_y = 0;
6152 
6153  p_scaler_params->out_rec_width = 0;
6154  p_scaler_params->out_rec_height = 0;
6155  p_scaler_params->out_rec_x = 0;
6156  p_scaler_params->out_rec_y = 0;
6157 
6158  p_scaler_params->rgba_color = 0;
6159  } else if (op == NI_SCALER_OPCODE_PAD)
6160  {
6161  // fixed params
6162  p_scaler_params->in_rec_width = p_scaler_params->input_width;
6163  p_scaler_params->in_rec_height = p_scaler_params->input_height;
6164  p_scaler_params->in_rec_x = 0;
6165  p_scaler_params->in_rec_y = 0;
6166 
6167  p_scaler_params->out_rec_width = p_scaler_params->input_width;
6168  p_scaler_params->out_rec_height = p_scaler_params->input_height;
6169 
6170  /*
6171  Scaler uses BGRA color, or ARGB in little-endian
6172  ui32RgbaColor = (s->rgba_color[3] << 24) | (s->rgba_color[0] << 16) |
6173  (s->rgba_color[1] << 8) | s->rgba_color[2];
6174  here p_scaler_params->rgba_color = ui32RgbaColor;
6175  */
6176  p_scaler_params->rgba_color =
6177  4278190080; // now padding color is black
6178 
6179  // params set by user
6180  p_scaler_params->out_rec_x = out_rec_x;
6181  p_scaler_params->out_rec_y = out_rec_y;
6182  } else if (op == NI_SCALER_OPCODE_OVERLAY)
6183  {
6184  // fixed params
6185  // set the in_rec params to the w/h of overlay(the upper) frames
6186  p_scaler_params->in_rec_width = p_scaler_params->input_width;
6187  p_scaler_params->in_rec_height = p_scaler_params->input_height;
6188 
6189  // the output w/h is the main frame's w/h (main frame is the lower/background frame)
6190  p_scaler_params->out_rec_width = p_scaler_params->output_width;
6191  p_scaler_params->out_rec_height = p_scaler_params->output_height;
6192  p_scaler_params->out_rec_x = 0;
6193  p_scaler_params->out_rec_y = 0;
6194  p_scaler_params->rgba_color = 0;
6195 
6196  // params set by user
6197  p_scaler_params->in_rec_x = in_rec_x;
6198  p_scaler_params->in_rec_y = in_rec_x;
6199  }
6200 }
6201 
6202 /*!*****************************************************************************
6203  * \brief open scaler session
6204  *
6205  * \param
6206  *
6207  * \return 0 if successful, < 0 otherwise
6208  ******************************************************************************/
6209 int scaler_session_open(ni_session_context_t *p_scaler_ctx, int iXcoderGUID,
6210  ni_scaler_opcode_t op)
6211 {
6212  int ret = 0;
6213 
6214  p_scaler_ctx->session_id = NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID;
6215 
6216  p_scaler_ctx->device_handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
6217  p_scaler_ctx->blk_io_handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
6218  p_scaler_ctx->hw_id = iXcoderGUID;
6219  p_scaler_ctx->device_type = NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER;
6220  p_scaler_ctx->scaler_operation = op;
6221  p_scaler_ctx->keep_alive_timeout = NI_DEFAULT_KEEP_ALIVE_TIMEOUT;
6222 
6223  ret = ni_device_session_open(p_scaler_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER);
6224 
6225  if (ret < 0)
6226  {
6227  fprintf(stderr, "Error: ni_scaler_session_open() failure!\n");
6228  return -1;
6229  } else
6230  {
6231 #ifdef _WIN32
6232  printf("Scaler session open: device_handle %p, session_id %u.\n",
6233  p_scaler_ctx->device_handle, p_scaler_ctx->session_id);
6234 #else
6235  printf("Scaler session open: device_handle %d, session_id %u.\n",
6236  p_scaler_ctx->device_handle, p_scaler_ctx->session_id);
6237 #endif
6238  return 0;
6239  }
6240 }
6241 
6242 /*!*****************************************************************************
6243  * \brief Launch scaler operation and get the result hw frame
6244  *
6245  * \param
6246  *
6247  * \return 0 if successful, < 0 otherwise
6248  ******************************************************************************/
6249 int launch_scaler_operation(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
6250  ni_frame_t *p_frame_in_up,
6251  ni_frame_t *p_frame_in_bg,
6252  ni_session_data_io_t *p_data_out,
6253  ni_scaler_input_params_t scaler_params)
6254 {
6255  int ret = 0;
6256  if (p_ctx->session_id == NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID)
6257  {
6258  // Open scaler session
6259  if (0 != scaler_session_open(p_ctx, 0, scaler_params.op))
6260  {
6261  fprintf(stderr, "Error: scaler open session error\n");
6262  return -1;
6263  }
6264 
6265  // init scaler hwframe pool
6266  if (0 != ni_scaler_frame_pool_alloc(p_ctx, scaler_params))
6267  {
6268  fprintf(stderr, "Error: init filter hwframe pool\n");
6269  return -1;
6270  }
6271  }
6272 
6273  // allocate a ni_frame_t structure on the host PC
6274  if (0 !=
6275  ni_frame_buffer_alloc_hwenc(&(p_data_out->data.frame),
6276  scaler_params.output_width,
6277  scaler_params.output_height, 0))
6278  {
6279  return -1;
6280  }
6281  niFrameSurface1_t *frame_surface_up;
6282  frame_surface_up = (niFrameSurface1_t *)((
6283  p_frame_in_up->p_data[3])); // out_frame retrieved from decoder
6284 
6285  // allocate scaler input frame
6286  if (0 !=
6287  ni_scaler_input_frame_alloc(p_ctx, scaler_params, frame_surface_up))
6288  {
6289  return -1;
6290  }
6291 
6292  niFrameSurface1_t *frame_surface_bg;
6293  frame_surface_bg = (niFrameSurface1_t *)((p_frame_in_bg->p_data[3]));
6294  // Allocate scaler destination frame.
6295  if (0 != ni_scaler_dest_frame_alloc(p_ctx, scaler_params, frame_surface_bg))
6296  {
6297  return -1;
6298  }
6299 
6300  // Retrieve hardware frame info from 2D engine and put it in the ni_frame_t structure.
6301  ret =
6302  ni_device_session_read_hwdesc(p_ctx, p_data_out, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER);
6303  if (ret < 0)
6304  {
6305  ni_frame_buffer_free(p_frame_in_up);
6306  ni_frame_buffer_free(p_frame_in_bg);
6307  ni_frame_buffer_free(&(p_data_out->data.frame));
6308  }
6309  return ret;
6310 }
6311 
6312 /*!*****************************************************************************
6313  * \brief Use crop->pad->overlay to simulate a drawbox filter.
6314  *
6315  * \param
6316  *
6317  * \return 0 if successful, < 0 otherwise
6318  ******************************************************************************/
6319 int drawbox_filter(ni_session_context_t *p_crop_ctx,
6320  ni_session_context_t *p_pad_ctx,
6321  ni_session_context_t *p_overlay_ctx,
6322  ni_session_context_t *p_fmt_ctx, ni_frame_t *p_frame_in,
6323  ni_session_data_io_t *p_data_out, box_params_t *p_box_params,
6324  int output_format)
6325 {
6326  // assume drawing box at the same position (can be set by box_params)
6327  // set default box params
6328  int box_width = 80;
6329  int box_height = 60;
6330  int box_x = 160;
6331  int box_y = 100;
6332  int line_width = 4;
6333  if (p_box_params)
6334  {
6335  box_width = ((int)((p_box_params->box_w + 1) / 2) * 2);
6336  box_height = ((int)((p_box_params->box_h + 1) / 2) * 2);
6337  box_x = p_box_params->box_x;
6338  box_y = p_box_params->box_y;
6339  }
6340 
6341  /*
6342  To simulate a drawbox filter, we need to
6343  1. Crop at the box set position
6344  2. Padding the crop output frame for fixed fixels (depends on the line_width of the box)
6345  Recycle the crop hwFrame
6346  3. Overlay the padding result on the original frame
6347  Recycle the padding hwFrame
6348  4. if format-change is needed, launch a scale operation and do format change
6349  Recycle the overlay hwFrame
6350  */
6351 
6352  int ret = 0;
6353  niFrameSurface1_t *p_surface_in;
6354  p_surface_in = (niFrameSurface1_t *)(p_frame_in->p_data[3]);
6355 
6356  ni_scaler_input_params_t crop_params = {0};
6357  crop_params.input_format = GC620_I420;
6358  crop_params.input_width = p_surface_in->ui16width;
6359  crop_params.input_height = p_surface_in->ui16height;
6360  crop_params.output_format = GC620_I420;
6361  crop_params.output_width = box_width;
6362  crop_params.output_height = box_height;
6363  init_scaler_params(&crop_params, NI_SCALER_OPCODE_CROP, box_width,
6364  box_height, box_x, box_y, 0, 0);
6365  ni_session_data_io_t crop_data = {0};
6366  ret = launch_scaler_operation(p_crop_ctx, p_frame_in, p_frame_in,
6367  &crop_data, crop_params);
6368  if (ret != 0)
6369  {
6370  printf("Failed to lauch scaler operation %d\n", crop_params.op);
6371  return -1;
6372  }
6373  niFrameSurface1_t *crop_frame_surface =
6374  (niFrameSurface1_t *)(crop_data.data.frame.p_data[3]);
6375 
6376  ni_scaler_input_params_t pad_params = {0};
6377  pad_params.input_format = GC620_I420;
6378  pad_params.input_width = crop_params.output_width;
6379  pad_params.input_height = crop_params.output_height;
6380  pad_params.output_format = GC620_I420;
6381  pad_params.output_width = crop_params.output_width + line_width * 2;
6382  pad_params.output_height = crop_params.output_height + line_width * 2;
6383  init_scaler_params(&pad_params, NI_SCALER_OPCODE_PAD, 0, 0, 0, 0,
6384  line_width, line_width);
6385  ni_session_data_io_t pad_data = {0};
6386  ret =
6387  launch_scaler_operation(p_pad_ctx, &(crop_data.data.frame),
6388  &(crop_data.data.frame), &pad_data, pad_params);
6389  // recycle HwFrameIdx first, then free the frame
6390  ni_hwframe_buffer_recycle(crop_frame_surface,
6391  crop_frame_surface->device_handle);
6392  ni_frame_buffer_free(&(crop_data.data.frame));
6393  if (ret != 0)
6394  {
6395  printf("Failed to lauch scaler operation %d\n", pad_params.op);
6396  return -1;
6397  }
6398  niFrameSurface1_t *pad_frame_surface =
6399  (niFrameSurface1_t *)(pad_data.data.frame.p_data[3]);
6400 
6401  ni_scaler_input_params_t overlay_params = {0};
6402  overlay_params.input_format = GC620_I420;
6403  overlay_params.input_width = pad_params.output_width;
6404  overlay_params.input_height = pad_params.output_height;
6405  overlay_params.output_format = GC620_I420;
6406  overlay_params.output_width = p_surface_in->ui16width;
6407  overlay_params.output_height = p_surface_in->ui16height;
6408  int overlay_x = (box_width > line_width) ? (box_width - line_width) : 0;
6409  int overlay_y = (box_height > line_width) ? (box_height - line_width) : 0;
6410  init_scaler_params(&overlay_params, NI_SCALER_OPCODE_OVERLAY, 0, 0,
6411  overlay_x, overlay_y, 0, 0);
6412  ni_session_data_io_t ovly_data = {0};
6413  if (output_format == GC620_I420)
6414  ret = launch_scaler_operation(p_overlay_ctx, &(pad_data.data.frame),
6415  p_frame_in, p_data_out, overlay_params);
6416  else
6417  ret = launch_scaler_operation(p_overlay_ctx, &(pad_data.data.frame),
6418  p_frame_in, &ovly_data, overlay_params);
6419  // recycle HwFrameIdx first, then free the frame
6420  ni_hwframe_buffer_recycle(pad_frame_surface,
6421  pad_frame_surface->device_handle);
6422  ni_frame_buffer_free(&(pad_data.data.frame));
6423  if (ret != 0)
6424  {
6425  printf("Failed to lauch scaler operation %d\n", overlay_params.op);
6426  return -1;
6427  }
6428 
6429  if (output_format != GC620_I420) // use scale filter to do format change
6430  {
6431  niFrameSurface1_t *ovly_frame_surface =
6432  (niFrameSurface1_t *)(ovly_data.data.frame.p_data[3]);
6433  ovly_frame_surface->ui16width = overlay_params.output_width;
6434  ovly_frame_surface->ui16height = overlay_params.output_height;
6435  ret = scale_filter(p_fmt_ctx, &(ovly_data.data.frame), p_data_out,
6436  overlay_params.output_width,
6437  overlay_params.output_height, output_format);
6438  ni_hwframe_buffer_recycle(ovly_frame_surface,
6439  ovly_frame_surface->device_handle);
6440  ni_frame_buffer_free(&(ovly_data.data.frame));
6441  if (ret != 0)
6442  {
6443  printf("Failed to lauch scaler operation 0\n");
6444  return -1;
6445  }
6446  }
6447 
6448  return 0;
6449 }
6450 
6451 /*!*****************************************************************************
6452  * \brief Do a scale and/or format-change operation.
6453  *
6454  * \param
6455  *
6456  * \return 0 if successful, < 0 otherwise
6457  ******************************************************************************/
6458 int scale_filter(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx, ni_frame_t *p_frame_in,
6459  ni_session_data_io_t *p_data_out, int scale_width,
6460  int scale_height, int out_format)
6461 {
6462  niFrameSurface1_t *p_surface_in;
6463  p_surface_in = (niFrameSurface1_t *)(p_frame_in->p_data[3]);
6464 
6465  ni_scaler_input_params_t scale_params;
6466  scale_params.output_format = out_format; // rgba or bgrp or yuv420p;
6467  scale_params.output_width = scale_width;
6468  scale_params.output_height = scale_height;
6469  scale_params.input_format =
6470  GC620_I420; // now assume the decoded frame format is GC620_I420;
6471  scale_params.input_width = p_surface_in->ui16width;
6472  scale_params.input_height = p_surface_in->ui16height;
6473  init_scaler_params(&scale_params, NI_SCALER_OPCODE_SCALE, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
6474  int ret = launch_scaler_operation(p_ctx, p_frame_in, p_frame_in, p_data_out,
6475  scale_params);
6476  if (ret != 0)
6477  {
6478  printf("Failed to lauch scaler operation %d\n", scale_params.op);
6479  return -1;
6480  }
6481  return 0;
6482 }
6483 
6484 /*!*****************************************************************************
6485  * \brief Write scaler p2p or hwdl output.
6486  *
6487  * \param
6488  *
6489  * \return 0 if successful, < 0 otherwise
6490  ******************************************************************************/
6491 int scaler_output_write(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
6492  ni_session_data_io_t *p_data_out, int out_width,
6493  int out_height, int out_format, FILE *fp,
6494  disp_buffer_t *disp)
6495 {
6496  if (!fp)
6497  return 0;
6498  niFrameSurface1_t *p_frame_surface =
6499  (niFrameSurface1_t *)(p_data_out->data.frame.p_data[3]);
6500  p_frame_surface->ui16width = out_width;
6501  p_frame_surface->ui16height = out_height;
6502  p_frame_surface->bit_depth = 1;
6503  p_frame_surface->encoding_type = NI_PIXEL_PLANAR_FORMAT_PLANAR;
6504  int ret;
6505 
6506  if (p_ctx->isP2P)
6507  {
6508 #ifndef _WIN32
6509  ret = read_from_dmabuf(p_ctx, p_frame_surface, disp, out_format, fp);
6510  if (ret != 0)
6511  {
6512  ni_frame_buffer_free(&(p_data_out->data.frame));
6513  return -1;
6514  }
6515 #endif
6516  } else
6517  {
6518  // use hwdownload to download hw frame, recycle hwframe buffer
6519  ni_session_data_io_t hwdl_session_data = {0};
6520  ret = hwdl_frame(p_ctx, &hwdl_session_data, &(p_data_out->data.frame),
6521  out_format);
6522  if (ret <= 0)
6523  {
6524  ni_frame_buffer_free(&(p_data_out->data.frame));
6525  return -1;
6526  }
6527 
6528  // write hwdl frame to output_file
6529  write_rawvideo_data(fp, out_width, out_height, out_format,
6530  &(hwdl_session_data.data.frame));
6531  ni_frame_buffer_free(&(hwdl_session_data.data.frame));
6532  }
6533  return 0;
6534 }
6535 
6536 // simplistic ref counted HW frame
6537 typedef struct _ni_hwframe_ref_t
6538 {
6539  int ref_cnt;
6540  niFrameSurface1_t frame;
6541 } ni_hwframe_ref_t;
6542 
6543 // HW frame (with reference count) pool tracker
6544 static ni_hwframe_ref_t hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[NI_MAX_DR_HWDESC_FRAME_INDEX];
6545 
6546 // final scan clean up of ref counted HW frame pool, return number of recycled
6547 // HW frames.
6548 int scan_and_clean_hwdescriptors_ref(ni_hwframe_ref_t ref_pool_tracker[])
6549 {
6550  int i;
6551  int recycled = 0;
6552  for (i = 0; i < NI_MAX_DR_HWDESC_FRAME_INDEX; i++)
6553  {
6554  if (ref_pool_tracker[i].ref_cnt &&
6555  ref_pool_tracker[i].frame.ui16FrameIdx)
6556  {
6557  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "clean/recycle frame idx %u ref_cnt %d\n,",
6558  ref_pool_tracker[i].frame.ui16FrameIdx,
6559  ref_pool_tracker[i].ref_cnt);
6560  ni_hwframe_buffer_recycle(&ref_pool_tracker[i].frame,
6561  ref_pool_tracker[i].frame.device_handle);
6562  ref_pool_tracker[i].frame.ui16FrameIdx = 0;
6563  ref_pool_tracker[i].ref_cnt = 0;
6564  recycled++;
6565  }
6566  }
6567  return recycled;
6568 }
6569 
6570 // reference HW frame
6571 void ni_hw_frame_ref(uint16_t hwframe_index, const uint8_t *frame)
6572 {
6573  hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].ref_cnt++;
6574  if (1 == hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].ref_cnt)
6575  {
6576  memcpy(&hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].frame, frame,
6577  sizeof(niFrameSurface1_t));
6578  }
6579  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s frame idx %u ref_cnt %d ..\n", __FUNCTION__,
6580  hwframe_index, hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].ref_cnt);
6581 }
6582 
6583 // unref HW frame
6584 void ni_hw_frame_unref(uint16_t hwframe_index)
6585 {
6586  if (hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].ref_cnt > 0)
6587  {
6588  hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].ref_cnt--;
6589  if (0 == hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].ref_cnt &&
6590  hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].frame.ui16FrameIdx)
6591  {
6592  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s frame idx recycing frame idx %u\n",
6593  __FUNCTION__,
6594  hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].frame.ui16FrameIdx);
6595 
6596  ni_hwframe_buffer_recycle(
6597  &hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].frame,
6598  hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].frame.device_handle);
6599  hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].frame.ui16FrameIdx = 0;
6600  }
6601  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s frame idx %u ref_cnt now: %d\n", __FUNCTION__,
6602  hwframe_index, hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].ref_cnt);
6603  } else
6604  {
6605  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "%s error frame idx %u ref_cnt %d <= 0\n",
6606  __FUNCTION__, hwframe_index,
6607  hwframe_ref_pool_tracker[hwframe_index].ref_cnt);
6608  }
6609 }
6610 
6611 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
6612 {
6613  tx_data_t sdPara = {0};
6614  rx_data_t rcPara = {0};
6615  device_state_t xcodeState = {0};
6616  // those variables with MAX_OUTPUT_FILES entries are for the support of
6617  // HW frame ladder encoding only.
6618  device_state_t xcodeStateList[MAX_OUTPUT_FILES];
6619  unsigned int number_of_packets_list[MAX_OUTPUT_FILES];
6620  int err = 0, pfs = 0, sos_flag = 0;
6621  char xcoderGUID[32];
6622  int iXcoderGUID = 0;
6623  uint32_t result = 0;
6624  unsigned long total_bytes_sent;
6625  unsigned long long total_bytes_received;
6626  unsigned long long total_bytes_received_list[MAX_OUTPUT_FILES];
6627  unsigned long long xcodeRecvTotal;
6628  FILE *p_file = NULL;
6629  FILE *p_file_list[MAX_OUTPUT_FILES];
6630  char outFileNameList[MAX_OUTPUT_FILES * FILE_NAME_LEN];
6631  char *n; // used for parsing width and height from --size
6632  char mode_description[128];
6633  int input_video_width;
6634  int input_video_height;
6635  int arg_width;
6636  int arg_height;
6637  int mode = -1;
6638  int multi_thread = 0;
6639  size_t i, j;
6640  int pkt_size;
6641  int input_exhausted = 0;
6642  int num_post_recycled = 0;
6643  ni_xcoder_params_t *p_api_param;
6644  ni_xcoder_params_t *p_dec_api_param;
6645  ni_xcoder_params_t *enc_ladder_api_param = NULL;
6646  niFrameSurface1_t *p_hwframe;
6647  char encConfXcoderParams[2048] = {0};
6648  char encLadderConfXcoderParams[MAX_OUTPUT_FILES][2048];
6649  char decConfXcoderParams[2048] = {0};
6650  char scaConfXcoderParams[2048] = {0};
6651  int ret = 0;
6652  int recycle_index = 0;
6653  ni_log_level_t log_level = NI_LOG_INFO;
6654 
6655  //inelegant solution but quick when memory is cheap
6656  niFrameSurface1_t hwframe_pool_tracker[NI_MAX_DR_HWDESC_FRAME_INDEX];
6657  memset(hwframe_pool_tracker, 0,
6658  NI_MAX_DR_HWDESC_FRAME_INDEX * sizeof(niFrameSurface1_t));
6659 
6660  memset(hwframe_ref_pool_tracker, 0,
6661  NI_MAX_DR_HWDESC_FRAME_INDEX * sizeof(ni_hwframe_ref_t));
6662 
6663  ni_device_handle_t dev_handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE,
6664  dev_handle_1 = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
6665  int src_codec_format = 0, dst_codec_format = 0;
6666  int bit_depth = 8;
6667 
6668  int input_arg_width[MAX_INPUT_FILES] = {0};
6669  int input_arg_height[MAX_INPUT_FILES] = {0};
6670  int input_bit_depth[MAX_INPUT_FILES];
6671  int input_arg_pfs[MAX_INPUT_FILES] = {0};
6672 
6673  ni_h264_sps_t SPS = {0}; // input header SPS
6674  ni_h265_sps_t HEVC_SPS = {0};
6675  ni_vp9_header_info_t VP9_INFO = {0};
6676  int input_index = 0, output_o_index = 0, output_x_index = 0;
6677  int input_total, output_total = 0;
6678  int size_index = 0;
6679  int bit_depth_index = 0;
6680  int is_planar = 1;
6681 
6682  // Input arg handling
6683  int opt;
6684  int opt_index;
6685  const char *opt_string = "hvtl:c:i:s:m:b:x:d:f:o:r:p:";
6686  static struct option long_options[] = {
6687  {"help", no_argument, NULL, 'h'},
6688  {"version", no_argument, NULL, 'v'},
6689  {"multi-thread", no_argument, NULL, 't'},
6690  {"loglevel", required_argument, NULL, 'l'},
6691  {"card", required_argument, NULL, 'c'},
6692  {"input", required_argument, NULL, 'i'},
6693  {"size", required_argument, NULL, 's'},
6694  {"mode", required_argument, NULL, 'm'},
6695  {"bitdepth", required_argument, NULL, 'b'},
6696  {"xcoder-params", required_argument, NULL, 'x'},
6697  {"decoder-params", required_argument, NULL, 'd'},
6698  {"scaler-params", required_argument, NULL, 'f'},
6699  {"output", required_argument, NULL, 'o'},
6700  {"repeat", required_argument, NULL, 'r'},
6701  {"is_planar", required_argument, NULL, 'p'},
6702  {NULL, 0, NULL, 0},
6703  };
6704 
6705  while ((opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, opt_string, long_options,
6706  &opt_index)) != -1)
6707  {
6708  switch (opt)
6709  {
6710  case 'h':
6711  print_usage();
6712  exit(0);
6713  case 'v':
6714  printf("Release ver: %s\n"
6715  "API ver: %s\n"
6716  "Date: %s\n"
6717  "ID: %s\n",
6718  NI_XCODER_REVISION, LIBXCODER_API_VERSION,
6719  NI_SW_RELEASE_TIME, NI_SW_RELEASE_ID);
6720  exit(0);
6721  case 't':
6722  multi_thread = 1;
6723  break;
6724  case 'l':
6725  log_level = arg_to_ni_log_level(optarg);
6726  if (log_level != NI_LOG_INVALID)
6727  {
6728  ni_log_set_level(log_level);
6729  } else {
6730  arg_error_exit("-l | --loglevel", optarg);
6731  }
6732  break;
6733  case 'c':
6734  strcpy(xcoderGUID, optarg);
6735  iXcoderGUID = (int)strtol(optarg, &n, 10);
6736  if (n ==
6737  xcoderGUID) // no numeric characters found in left side of optarg
6738  arg_error_exit("-c | --card", optarg);
6739  break;
6740  case 'i':
6741  if (input_index == MAX_INPUT_FILES)
6742  {
6743  printf("Error: number of input files cannot exceed %d\n", MAX_INPUT_FILES);
6744  exit(-1);
6745  }
6746  strcpy(sdPara.fileName[input_index], optarg);
6747  input_index++;
6748  break;
6749  case 's':
6750  if (size_index == MAX_INPUT_FILES)
6751  {
6752  printf("Error: number of input resolutions cannot exceed %d\n", MAX_INPUT_FILES);
6753  exit(-1);
6754  }
6755  input_arg_width[size_index] = (int)strtol(optarg, &n, 10);
6756  input_arg_height[size_index] = atoi(n + 1);
6757  if ((*n != 'x') || (!input_arg_width[size_index] || !input_arg_height[size_index]))
6758  arg_error_exit("-s | --size", optarg);
6759  size_index++;
6760  break;
6761  case 'm':
6762  if (!(strlen(optarg) == 3))
6763  arg_error_exit("-, | --mode", optarg);
6764  // convert to lower case for processing
6765  for (i = 0; i < strlen(optarg); i++)
6766  optarg[i] = (char)tolower((unsigned char)optarg[i]);
6767 
6768  if (strcmp(optarg, "y2a") != 0 && strcmp(optarg, "y2h") != 0 &&
6769  strcmp(optarg, "a2y") != 0 && strcmp(optarg, "a2a") != 0 &&
6770  strcmp(optarg, "a2h") != 0 && strcmp(optarg, "h2y") != 0 &&
6771  strcmp(optarg, "h2a") != 0 && strcmp(optarg, "h2h") != 0 &&
6772  strcmp(optarg, "u2a") != 0 && strcmp(optarg, "u2h") != 0 &&
6773  strcmp(optarg, "a2r") != 0 && strcmp(optarg, "h2r") != 0 &&
6774  strcmp(optarg, "u2x") != 0 && strcmp(optarg, "y2x") != 0 &&
6775  strcmp(optarg, "v2y") != 0 && strcmp(optarg, "y2o") != 0 &&
6776  strcmp(optarg, "v2a") != 0 && strcmp(optarg, "v2h") != 0 &&
6777  strcmp(optarg, "v2x") != 0 && strcmp(optarg, "a2x") != 0 &&
6778  strcmp(optarg, "h2x") != 0)
6779  arg_error_exit("-, | --mode", optarg);
6780 
6781  // determine dec/enc/xcod mode to use
6782  if (optarg[0] == 'y')
6783  {
6784  sprintf(mode_description, "Encoding");
6785  mode = XCODER_APP_ENCODE;
6786  } else if (optarg[2] == 'y')
6787  {
6788  sprintf(mode_description, "Decoding");
6789  mode = XCODER_APP_DECODE;
6790  } else if ((optarg[0] == 'y') && (optarg[2] == 'y'))
6791  {
6792  arg_error_exit("-, | --mode", optarg);
6793  } else if (optarg[0] == 'u')
6794  {
6795  sprintf(mode_description, "HWUpload + Encoding");
6796  mode = XCODER_APP_HWUP_ENCODE;
6797  } else if (optarg[2] == 'r')
6798  {
6799  sprintf(mode_description, "Decoding + filtering");
6800  mode = XCODER_APP_FILTER;
6801  } else
6802  {
6803  sprintf(mode_description, "Transcoding");
6804  mode = XCODER_APP_TRANSCODE;
6805  }
6806 
6807  // determine codecs to use
6808  if (optarg[0] == 'a')
6809  {
6810  src_codec_format = NI_CODEC_FORMAT_H264;
6811  strcat(mode_description, " from AVC");
6812  }
6813  if (optarg[0] == 'h')
6814  {
6815  src_codec_format = NI_CODEC_FORMAT_H265;
6816  strcat(mode_description, " from HEVC");
6817  }
6818  if (optarg[0] == 'v')
6819  {
6820  src_codec_format = NI_CODEC_FORMAT_VP9;
6821  strcat(mode_description, " from VP9");
6822  }
6823  if (optarg[2] == 'a')
6824  {
6825  dst_codec_format = NI_CODEC_FORMAT_H264;
6826  strcat(mode_description, " to AVC");
6827  }
6828  if (optarg[2] == 'h')
6829  {
6830  dst_codec_format = NI_CODEC_FORMAT_H265;
6831  strcat(mode_description, " to HEVC");
6832  }
6833  if (optarg[2] == 'x')
6834  {
6835  dst_codec_format = NI_CODEC_FORMAT_AV1;
6836  strcat(mode_description, " to AV1");
6837  }
6838  if (optarg[2] == 'o')
6839  {
6840  dst_codec_format = NI_CODEC_FORMAT_AV1;
6841  av1_output_obu = 1;
6842  strcat(mode_description, " to AV1 OBU");
6843  }
6844  break;
6845  case 'b':
6846  if (bit_depth_index == MAX_INPUT_FILES)
6847  {
6848  printf("Error: cannot input more than %d bitdepth\n", MAX_INPUT_FILES);
6849  exit(-1);
6850  }
6851  if (!(atoi(optarg) == 8 || atoi(optarg) == 10))
6852  arg_error_exit("-b | --bitdepth", optarg);
6853  input_bit_depth[bit_depth_index] = atoi(optarg);
6854  bit_depth_index++;
6855  break;
6856  case 'x':
6857  strcpy(encConfXcoderParams, optarg);
6858  if (output_x_index == MAX_OUTPUT_FILES)
6859  {
6860  printf("Error: number of encoder config cannot exceed %d\n",
6861  MAX_OUTPUT_FILES);
6862  exit(-1);
6863  }
6864 
6865  strcpy(encLadderConfXcoderParams[output_x_index], optarg);
6866  output_x_index++;
6867  break;
6868  case 'd':
6869  strcpy(decConfXcoderParams, optarg);
6870  break;
6871  case 'f':
6872  strcpy(scaConfXcoderParams, optarg);
6873  break;
6874  case 'o':
6875  strcpy(rcPara.fileName, optarg);
6876  if (output_o_index == MAX_OUTPUT_FILES)
6877  {
6878  printf("Error: number of output files cannot exceed %d\n",
6879  MAX_OUTPUT_FILES);
6880  exit(-1);
6881  }
6882 
6883  for (i = 0; i < output_o_index; i++)
6884  {
6885  if (0 == strcmp(&outFileNameList[i * FILE_NAME_LEN],
6886  optarg))
6887  {
6888  printf("Error: output file names must be unique: %s\n",
6889  optarg);
6890  exit(-1);
6891  }
6892  }
6893 
6894  strcpy(&outFileNameList[output_o_index * FILE_NAME_LEN],
6895  optarg);
6896  output_o_index++;
6897  break;
6898  case 'r':
6899  if (!(atoi(optarg) >= 1))
6900  arg_error_exit("-r | --repeat", optarg);
6901  g_repeat = atoi(optarg);
6902  break;
6903  case 'p':
6904  is_planar = atoi(optarg) >= 1;
6905  break;
6906  default:
6907  print_usage();
6908  exit(1);
6909  }
6910  }
6911 
6912  // sequence change input parameter check
6913  if (input_index != size_index)
6914  {
6915  if (mode == XCODER_APP_ENCODE)
6916  {
6917  printf("Error: number of input files %d does not match with number of input resolutions %d\n", input_index, size_index);
6918  exit(-1);
6919  }
6920  }
6921 
6922  input_total = input_index;
6923 
6924  if (input_total > 1)
6925  {
6926  if (mode != XCODER_APP_ENCODE)
6927  {
6928  printf("Error: multiple input files not supported for mode %d\n", mode);
6929  exit(-1);
6930  }
6931 
6932  if (g_repeat > 1)
6933  {
6934  printf("Error: multiple input files not supported when repeat %d greater than one\n", g_repeat);
6935  exit(-1);
6936  }
6937  }
6938 
6939  // checking for HW frame ladder encode support
6940  if (output_o_index > 1 && output_o_index != output_x_index)
6941  {
6942  printf("Error: number of output files: %d does not match number of "
6943  "encode config: %d\n",
6944  output_o_index, output_x_index);
6945  exit(-1);
6946  }
6947 
6948  if (output_o_index > 1 &&
6949  (XCODER_APP_HWUP_ENCODE != mode || multi_thread ||
6950  NI_CODEC_FORMAT_AV1 == dst_codec_format))
6951  {
6952  printf("Error: ladder encode is only supported for HW frame encode, "
6953  "non-AV1 codec and single thread.\n");
6954  exit(-1);
6955  }
6956 
6957  output_total = output_o_index;
6958 
6959  for ( ; bit_depth_index < MAX_INPUT_FILES; bit_depth_index++)
6960  {
6961  input_bit_depth[bit_depth_index] = 8;
6962  }
6963 
6964  arg_width = input_arg_width[0];
6965  arg_height = input_arg_height[0];
6966  bit_depth = input_bit_depth[0];
6967 
6968  // Check required args are present
6969  if (!sdPara.fileName[0][0])
6970  {
6971  printf("Error: missing argument for -i | --input\n");
6972  exit(-1);
6973  }
6974 
6975  p_api_param = malloc(sizeof(*p_api_param));
6976  if (!p_api_param)
6977  {
6978  printf("Error: failed to allocate p_api_param\n");
6979  exit(-1);
6980  }
6981 
6982  p_dec_api_param = malloc(sizeof(*p_dec_api_param));
6983  if (!p_dec_api_param)
6984  {
6985  printf("Error: failed to allocate p_dec_api_param\n");
6986  free(p_api_param);
6987  exit(-1);
6988  }
6989 
6990  for (input_index = 0; input_index < input_total; input_index++)
6991  {
6992  if (!sdPara.fileName[input_index][0])
6993  {
6994  printf("Error: incorrect input file %d\n", input_index);
6995  exit(-1);
6996  }
6997 
6998 #ifdef _WIN32
6999  input_arg_pfs[input_index] = open(sdPara.fileName[input_index], O_RDONLY | O_BINARY);
7000 #else
7001  input_arg_pfs[input_index] = open(sdPara.fileName[input_index], O_RDONLY);
7002 #endif
7003 
7004  if (input_arg_pfs[input_index] < 0)
7005  {
7006  fprintf(stderr, "Error: cannot open %s\n", sdPara.fileName[input_index]);
7007  fprintf(stderr, "Error: input file read failure\n");
7008  err_flag = 1;
7009  goto end;
7010  }
7011  printf("SUCCESS: Opened input file: %s with file id = %d\n",
7012  sdPara.fileName[input_index], input_arg_pfs[input_index]);
7013  }
7014 
7015  input_index = 0;
7016  pfs = input_arg_pfs[0];
7017 
7018  if ((mode != XCODER_APP_TRANSCODE) && (mode != XCODER_APP_DECODE) &&
7019  (mode != XCODER_APP_ENCODE) && (mode != XCODER_APP_HWUP_ENCODE) &&
7020  (mode != XCODER_APP_FILTER))
7021  {
7022  printf("Error: missing argument for -m | --mode\n");
7023  exit(-1);
7024  }
7025  if (!rcPara.fileName[0])
7026  {
7027  printf("Error: missing argument for -o | --output\n");
7028  exit(-1);
7029  }
7030 
7031  sdPara.mode = mode;
7032  rcPara.mode = mode;
7033 
7034  // Print high-level description of processing to occur and codecs involved
7035  printf("%s...\n", mode_description);
7036 
7037  pkt_size = 131040; // hardcoded input data chunk size (for H.265)
7038 
7039  lseek(pfs, 0, SEEK_END);
7040  total_file_size = lseek(pfs, 0, SEEK_CUR);
7041  lseek(pfs, 0, SEEK_SET);
7042  if (mode == XCODER_APP_ENCODE || mode == XCODER_APP_HWUP_ENCODE)
7043  {
7044  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "YUV input read will repeat %d times\n", g_repeat);
7045  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "YUV input, do not read all to cache\n");
7046  } else
7047  {
7048  uint32_t read_chunk = 4096;
7049  uint64_t tmpFileSize = total_file_size;
7050 
7051  //try to allocate memory for input file buffer, quit if failure
7052  if (total_file_size > 0 && !(g_file_cache = malloc(total_file_size)))
7053  {
7054  fprintf(stderr,
7055  "Error: input file size %llu exceeding max malloc, quit\n",
7056  (unsigned long long)total_file_size);
7057  goto end;
7058  }
7059  g_curr_cache_pos = g_file_cache;
7060  printf("Reading %llu bytes in total ..\n", (unsigned long long)total_file_size);
7061 
7062  while (tmpFileSize)
7063  {
7064  if (read_chunk > tmpFileSize)
7065  {
7066  read_chunk = tmpFileSize;
7067  }
7068  int one_read_size = read(pfs, g_curr_cache_pos, read_chunk);
7069  if (one_read_size == -1)
7070  {
7071  fprintf(stderr, "Error: reading file, quit! left-to-read %llu\n",
7072  (unsigned long long)tmpFileSize);
7073  fprintf(stderr, "Error: input file read error\n");
7074  goto end;
7075  } else
7076  {
7077  tmpFileSize -= one_read_size;
7078  g_curr_cache_pos += one_read_size;
7079  }
7080  }
7081  printf("read %llu bytes from input file into memory\n", (unsigned long long)total_file_size);
7082  }
7083  g_curr_cache_pos = g_file_cache;
7084  data_left_size = total_file_size;
7085 
7086  // HWUP + ladder encode single-thread uses multi output setup
7087  if (XCODER_APP_HWUP_ENCODE == mode && !multi_thread)
7088  {
7089  for (i = 0; i < output_total; i++)
7090  {
7091  if (strcmp(&outFileNameList[i * FILE_NAME_LEN], "null") != 0 &&
7092  strcmp(&outFileNameList[i * FILE_NAME_LEN], "/dev/null") != 0)
7093  {
7094  p_file_list[i] =
7095  fopen(&outFileNameList[i * FILE_NAME_LEN], "wb");
7096  if (p_file_list[i] == NULL)
7097  {
7098  fprintf(stderr, "Error: cannot open %s\n",
7099  &outFileNameList[i * FILE_NAME_LEN]);
7100  err_flag = 1;
7101  goto end;
7102  }
7103  printf("SUCCESS: Opened output file: %s\n",
7104  &outFileNameList[i * FILE_NAME_LEN]);
7105  } else
7106  {
7107  p_file_list[i] = NULL;
7108  printf("SUCCESS: output %d file %s implies dropping output\n",
7109  (int)i + 1, &outFileNameList[i * FILE_NAME_LEN]);
7110  }
7111  }
7112  } else
7113  {
7114  if (strcmp(rcPara.fileName, "null") != 0 &&
7115  strcmp(rcPara.fileName, "/dev/null") != 0)
7116  {
7117  p_file = fopen(rcPara.fileName, "wb");
7118  if (p_file == NULL)
7119  {
7120  fprintf(stderr, "Error: cannot open %s\n", rcPara.fileName);
7121  err_flag = 1;
7122  goto end;
7123  }
7124  printf("SUCCESS: Opened output file: %s\n", rcPara.fileName);
7125  } else
7126  {
7127  printf("SUCCESS: output file %s implies dropping output\n",
7128  rcPara.fileName);
7129  }
7130  }
7131 
7132  enc_ladder_api_param = calloc(output_total, sizeof(ni_xcoder_params_t));
7133  if (!enc_ladder_api_param)
7134  {
7135  fprintf(stderr, "Error: calloc for enc ladder parameters.\n");
7136  goto end;
7137  }
7138 
7139  // for H.264, probe the source and use the probed source info as defaults
7140  if (NI_CODEC_FORMAT_H264 == src_codec_format &&
7141  (mode == XCODER_APP_TRANSCODE || mode == XCODER_APP_DECODE ||
7142  mode == XCODER_APP_FILTER))
7143  {
7144  if (probe_h264_stream_info(&SPS))
7145  {
7146  fprintf(stderr,
7147  "ERROR: H.264 file probing complete, source file format "
7148  "not supported !\n");
7149  goto end;
7150  }
7151 
7152  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Using probed H.264 source info: %d bits "
7153  "resolution %dx%d\n",
7154  SPS.bit_depth_luma, SPS.width, SPS.height);
7155  bit_depth = SPS.bit_depth_luma;
7156  arg_width = SPS.width;
7157  arg_height = SPS.height;
7158  } else if (NI_CODEC_FORMAT_H265 == src_codec_format &&
7159  (mode == XCODER_APP_DECODE || mode == XCODER_APP_TRANSCODE))
7160  {
7161  if (probe_h265_stream_info(&HEVC_SPS))
7162  {
7163  fprintf(stderr,
7164  "ERROR: H.265 file probing complete, source file format "
7165  "not supported !\n");
7166  goto end;
7167  }
7168  bit_depth = HEVC_SPS.bit_depth_chroma;
7169  arg_width = (int)(HEVC_SPS.width -
7170  (HEVC_SPS.pic_conf_win.left_offset +
7171  HEVC_SPS.pic_conf_win.right_offset));
7172  arg_height = (int)(HEVC_SPS.height -
7173  (HEVC_SPS.pic_conf_win.top_offset +
7174  HEVC_SPS.pic_conf_win.bottom_offset));
7175  ni_log(NI_LOG_INFO,
7176  "Using probed H.265 source info: %d bits "
7177  "resolution %dx%d\n",
7178  HEVC_SPS.bit_depth_chroma, arg_width, arg_height);
7179  } else if (NI_CODEC_FORMAT_VP9 == src_codec_format &&
7180  (mode == XCODER_APP_DECODE || mode == XCODER_APP_TRANSCODE))
7181  {
7182  if (probe_vp9_stream_info(&VP9_INFO))
7183  {
7184  fprintf(stderr,
7185  "ERROR: VP9 file probing complete, source file format "
7186  "not supported !\n");
7187  goto end;
7188  }
7189  ni_log(NI_LOG_INFO,
7190  "Using probed VP9 source info: %d profile "
7191  "resolution %dx%d, timebase %d/%d\n",
7192  VP9_INFO.profile, VP9_INFO.width, VP9_INFO.height,
7193  VP9_INFO.timebase.den, VP9_INFO.timebase.num);
7194  bit_depth = VP9_INFO.profile ? 10 : 8;
7195  arg_width = VP9_INFO.width;
7196  arg_height = VP9_INFO.height;
7197  }
7198 
7199  sdPara.arg_width = arg_width;
7200  sdPara.arg_height = arg_height;
7201  rcPara.arg_width = arg_width;
7202  rcPara.arg_height = arg_height;
7203 
7204  // set up decoder p_config with some hard coded numbers
7205  if (ni_decoder_init_default_params(p_dec_api_param, 25, 1, 200000, arg_width,
7206  arg_height) < 0)
7207  {
7208  fprintf(stderr, "Error: decoder p_config set up error\n");
7209  return -1;
7210  }
7211 
7212  send_fin_flag = 0;
7213  receive_fin_flag = 0;
7214 
7215  ni_session_context_t dec_ctx = {0};
7216  ni_session_context_t enc_ctx = {0};
7217  ni_session_context_t enc_ladder_ctx_list[MAX_OUTPUT_FILES];
7218  ni_session_context_t upl_ctx = {0};
7219  ni_session_context_t sca_ctx = {0};
7220  ni_session_context_t crop_ctx = {0};
7221  ni_session_context_t pad_ctx = {0};
7222  ni_session_context_t ovly_ctx = {0};
7223  ni_session_context_t fmt_ctx = {0};
7224 
7225  if (ni_device_session_context_init(&dec_ctx) < 0)
7226  {
7227  fprintf(stderr, "Error: init decoder context error\n");
7228  return -1;
7229  }
7230  if (ni_device_session_context_init(&enc_ctx) < 0)
7231  {
7232  fprintf(stderr, "Error: init encoder context error\n");
7233  return -1;
7234  }
7235  for (i = 0; i < output_total; i++)
7236  {
7237  if (ni_device_session_context_init(&enc_ladder_ctx_list[i]) < 0)
7238  {
7239  fprintf(stderr, "Error: init encoder ladder %d context error\n",
7240  (int)i);
7241  return -1;
7242  }
7243  }
7244 
7245  if (ni_device_session_context_init(&upl_ctx) < 0)
7246  {
7247  fprintf(stderr, "Error: init decoder context error\n");
7248  return -1;
7249  }
7250 
7251  if (ni_device_session_context_init(&sca_ctx) < 0)
7252  {
7253  fprintf(stderr, "Error: init decoder context error\n");
7254  return -1;
7255  }
7256 
7257  if (ni_device_session_context_init(&crop_ctx) < 0)
7258  {
7259  fprintf(stderr, "Error: init decoder context error\n");
7260  return -1;
7261  }
7262 
7263  if (ni_device_session_context_init(&pad_ctx) < 0)
7264  {
7265  fprintf(stderr, "Error: init decoder context error\n");
7266  return -1;
7267  }
7268 
7269  if (ni_device_session_context_init(&ovly_ctx) < 0)
7270  {
7271  fprintf(stderr, "Error: init decoder context error\n");
7272  return -1;
7273  }
7274 
7275  if (ni_device_session_context_init(&fmt_ctx) < 0)
7276  {
7277  fprintf(stderr, "Error: init decoder context error\n");
7278  return -1;
7279  }
7280 
7281  sdPara.p_dec_ctx = (void *)&dec_ctx;
7282  sdPara.p_enc_ctx = (void *)&enc_ctx;
7283  sdPara.p_upl_ctx = (void *)&upl_ctx;
7284  sdPara.p_sca_ctx = (void *)&sca_ctx;
7285  sdPara.p_crop_ctx = (void *)&crop_ctx;
7286  sdPara.p_pad_ctx = (void *)&pad_ctx;
7287  sdPara.p_ovly_ctx = (void *)&ovly_ctx;
7288  sdPara.p_fmt_ctx = (void *)&fmt_ctx;
7289  rcPara.p_dec_ctx = (void *)&dec_ctx;
7290  rcPara.p_enc_ctx = (void *)&enc_ctx;
